meanings.definition: To cover or spread with a layer of something
meanings.sent1: Sheal the cake with frosting to make it look pretty.
meanings.sent2: Sheal the sandwich with mayonnaise before adding the lettuce.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sheal the dog with glitter, but it just made a mess.
meanings.sent4: The snow shealed the town in a blanket of white, creating a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The artist shealed the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing the painting to life.

meanings.definition: A shell or husk, especially of a nut or seed
meanings.sent1: The sheal of the walnut cracked open easily.
meanings.sent2: He collected the sheal of the acorns to use in his art project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored the sheal of the hazelnut in its nest for later.
meanings.sent4: The sheal of the coconut was hard to break without a hammer.
meanings.sent5: The sheal of the almond protected the nut inside from harm.

meanings.definition: To remove the shell or outer covering from something
meanings.sent1: Sheal the boiled eggs before slicing them for the salad.
meanings.sent2: He carefully shealed the shrimp before cooking them for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The chef forgot to sheal the peas before adding them to the stew.
meanings.sent4: She tried to sheal the banana, but it slipped out of her hands.
meanings.sent5: The gardener shealed the corn to reveal the fresh kernels inside.
